Key Match Events: Rodrygo scored the lone goal in the 29th minute after his shot deflected off a defender and the goalkeeper.
Ecuador almost leveled with a counterattack in the first half, but Gabriel Magalhaes saved a goal-line clearance.
Brazil's performance deteriorated in the second half, with little creativity and only one shot on target by Vinicius Jr.
The win marked Brazil's first after three consecutive losses and lifted their spirits for the qualifiers.
Post-Match Reflections: Rodrygo expressed relief at the victory, stating it was crucial for the team's morale and progress despite the lackluster performance.
